CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ruth Taylor, of 7040 Monticello Street was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 28, 1959, pg. 1 with question: "Do you think that education standards should be the same throughout the city school system or should they be lowered in order to accommodate the slower-learning pupils, particularly those who suffer the handicaps of poor home or neighborhood environments?" answer reads: "No, the educational standards must not be lowered. For those children who are slow learners, they should be put into special classes with special teachers like the schools have been doing."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of smiling Ruth Taylor wearing light colored coat with shawl collar, holding bag, and standing on sidewalk
